dr.math.interfaces
Interface CurveMouseClickListener

public interface CurveMouseClickListener

A CurveMouseClickListener defines an interface to handle mouse click performed on a scatterplot and passed to a curve definition.

Author:
Didier H. Besset
See Also:
Scatterplot, CurveDefinition

Method Summary
 boolean handleMouseClick(int index, java.lang.Object param)
          Processes the mouse clicks received from the scatterplot.
 

Method Detail

handleMouseClick

boolean handleMouseClick(int index,
                         java.lang.Object param)
Processes the mouse clicks received from the scatterplot. If a mouse listener has been defined, each point is tested for mouse click. If the mouse click falls within the symbol size of a point, the index of that point is passed to the mouse listener, along with the defined parameter.

Parameters:
index - index of the curve point on which the mouse was clicked.
param - the curve identifier.
See Also:
#setMouseListener
